description: Creates a new routing control. A routing control has one of two states: ON and OFF. You can map the routing control state to the state of an Amazon Route 53 health check, which can be used to control traffic routing. To get or update the routing control state, see the Recovery Cluster (data plane) API actions for Amazon Route 53 Application Recovery Controller.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive string of up to 64 ASCII characters. To make an idempotent API request with an action, specify a client token in the request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: ClusterArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster that includes the routing control.

parameters.name: RoutingControlName
parameters.description: The name of the routing control.

nested_items.name: RoutingControl
nested_items.description: The routing control that is created.

nested_items.name: ControlPanelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the control panel that includes the routing control.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the routing control.

nested_items.name: RoutingControlArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the routing control.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The deployment status of a routing control. Status can be one of the following: PENDING, DEPLOYED, PENDING_DELETION.

nested_items.name: Owner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the routing control owner.
